1430/A0/04/806/007.status_value: While data in 2011 showed a high GER of 118.6%  NER was 87.9%. However  in 2012 data showed a decrease of NER to 86.7%  although GER is not yet available. From the trend  it could be that there is an increase in GER. This data compounded the fact that there are many children who attend school at an unofficial age.

2012 ¿ 39%. Unfortunately  the target is not met and this data further reiterated the fact that there is very low percentage of children who are of the official primary school-entrance age. A strong policy and legislation review is being advocated for  as this also has implications for school readiness and why there is low survival rate.

In 2011  data showed that survival rate for single year survival was 82.5%  while average rate by level was 69.5%  which is 12.5% less than the target. This is also a decrease from the baseline  which suggests that many factors are in play and need to be addressed.
